FK.content: “responsibility of repetition in the wager (gage) of decision or of affirmation (re-legere) which links up with itself to link with the other” [desert, messianic, khōra]
FK.linkedContent: “responsibility of repetition in the wager (gage) of decision or of affirmation (re-legere) which links up with itself to link with the other” [desert, messianic, khōra]

FK.content: yes, yes: answering machine & possibility of radical evil; yes, yes: testimonial affirmation & reactivity; yes, yes: order of faith, trust in address of the other & mechanical machine-like division
FK.linkedContent: yes, yes: answering machine & possibility of radical evil; yes, yes: testimonial affirmation & reactivity; yes, yes: order of faith, trust in address of the other & mechanical machine-like division

LOBL.content: is the double affirmation triumphant or a paradoxical phase in work of mourning [re: Freud’s manic fantasy]? p. ~101 one never writes in one’s own language or in a  foreign language > derive all consequences of this, from each element: hence the triumph (necessarily double & equivocal, because also a phase of mourning)
LOBL.linkedContent: is the double affirmation triumphant or a paradoxical phase in work of mourning [re: Freud’s manic fantasy]? p. ~101 one never writes in one’s own language or in a foreign language > derive all consequences of this, from each element: hence the triumph (necessarily double & equivocal, because also a phase of mourning)

LOBL.content: double affirmation: of death which triumphs over life, & triumph of life at edge of death
LOBL.linkedContent: double affirmation: of death which triumphs over life, & triumph of life at edge of death

LOBL.content: [extensive description] yes of event, yes of iteration, quotes, cites, in accordance w/ strange ring outside of presence, sur-vives
LOBL.linkedContent: [extensive description] yes of event, yes of iteration, quotes, cites, in accordance w/ strange ring outside of presence, sur-vives

LOBL.content: ring is sealed by arrêt de mort (syntax, almost untranslatable, is sealed in this French expression)
LOBL.linkedContent: ring is sealed by arrêt de mort (syntax, almost untranslatable, is sealed in this French expression)

LOBL.content: Blanchot’s come, come, Derrida’s yes, yes
is double affirmation same as Freud’s triumph? wouldn’t this risk negativity of mourning, economic resentment, melancholia in “yes, yes”? can this be avoided?
LOBL.linkedContent: is double affirmation same as Freud’s triumph? wouldn’t this risk negativity of mourning, economic resentment, melancholia in “yes, yes”? can this be avoided?

LOBL.content: yes to yes w/out self-recollection, the must not or need not know yourself, the interdiction of each event, interposes an unconscious between the event and the experience of it, between living-on and presence
LOBL.linkedContent: yes to yes w/out self-recollection, the must not or need not know yourself, the interdiction of each event, interposes an unconscious between the event and the experience of it, between living-on and presence

LOBL.content: to speak of writing, triumph, as living on, is to denounce [Freud’s] manic fantasy (not w/out repeating it)
LOBL.linkedContent: to speak of writing, triumph, as living on, is to denounce [Freud’s] manic fantasy (not w/out repeating it)

AF.content: 1<sup><small>st</small></sup> yes is promise, 2<sup><small>nd</small></sup> yes is engage; affirmation of affirmation, “inaugural engagement of a promise or of an anticipation which wagers, a priori, the very future”
AF.linkedContent: 1st yes is promise, 2nd yes is engage; affirmation of affirmation, “inaugural engagement of a promise or of an anticipation which wagers, a priori, the very future”

SPOM.content: irreducible possibility of Un-fug: resource & injunction of reaffirmed affirmation
SPOM.linkedContent: irreducible possibility of Un-fug: resource & injunction of reaffirmed affirmation

SPOM.content: deconstruction links an affirmation to the experience of the impossible, radical experience of perhaps
SPOM.linkedContent: deconstruction links an affirmation to the experience of the impossible, radical experience of perhaps

SPOM.content: “ascesis strips the messianic hope of all biblical forms…all determinable figures…denudes itself in view of responding to that which must be absolute hospitality, the ‘yes’ to the arrivant(e), the “come” to the future (l’avenir) that cannot be anticipated”
SPOM.linkedContent: “ascesis strips the messianic hope of all biblical forms…all determinable figures…denudes itself in view of responding to that which must be absolute hospitality, the ‘yes’ to the arrivant(e), the “come” to the future (l’avenir) that cannot be anticipated”

SPOM.content: “we must practice recognizing (s’exercer à reconnaître)” those too familiar ghosts
SPOM.linkedContent: “we must practice recognizing (s’exercer à reconnaître)” those too familiar ghosts

SPOM.content: open, waiting for event as justice, this hospitality is absolute only if it “keeps watch (veille)” over its own universality (messianic is always revolutionary, has to be)
SPOM.linkedContent: open, waiting for event as justice, this hospitality is absolute only if it “keeps watch (veille)” over its own universality (messianic is always revolutionary, has to be)

POOF.content: promise before friendships linked to ‘yes, yes’—beyond position > resituate the ‘concept of the political’
POOF.linkedContent: promise before friendships linked to ‘yes, yes’—beyond position > resituate the ‘concept of the political’

POO.content: affirmation of excess always spurs a counter-moralism
POO.linkedContent: affirmation of excess always spurs a counter-moralism

POO.content: affirmation beyond ethics, morality, politics, responsibility, or the subject

MPM.content: de Man’s affirmation of memory, an alliance or ring more ancient, secret, resistant than familial or strategic alliances it makes possible, but is never reduced to
MPM.linkedContent: de Man’s affirmation of memory, an alliance or ring more ancient, secret, resistant than familial or strategic alliances it makes possible, but is never reduced to

MPM.content: affirmation (yes, yes) that seals alliance, via de Man > alliance not secret because occult but because it commits before and beyond anything else
MPM.linkedContent: affirmation (yes, yes) that seals alliance, via de Man > alliance not secret because occult but because it commits before and beyond anything else

MPM.content: ”yes” commits w/ no content must repeat itself: yes yes, must bind itself to memory for memory, if anything’s to come from future [alliance btwn memory and seal of yes, yes]
MPM.linkedContent: ”yes” commits w/ no content must repeat itself: yes yes, must bind itself to memory for memory, if anything’s to come from future [alliance btwn memory and seal of yes, yes]

MPM.content: experience at heart of memory (Being & law), memorial, memoirs, mournful in essence, contracts itself together in impossible affirmation of mourning
MPM.linkedContent: experience at heart of memory (Being & law), memorial, memoirs, mournful in essence, contracts itself together in impossible affirmation of mourning

MPM.content: the coming of the impossible other, we love as such, affirming this to be good
MPM.linkedContent: the coming of the impossible other, we love as such, affirming this to be good

MPM.content: uncontrollable necessity, nonsubjectivizable law of thought beyond interiorization, beyond un-mourning thought mourning > can we accept it? affirm it? can no longer become a question
MPM.linkedContent: uncontrollable necessity, nonsubjectivizable law of thought beyond interiorization, beyond un-mourning thought mourning > can we accept it? affirm it? can no longer become a question

MPM.content: all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other
MPM.linkedContent: all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other

MPM.content: you can only say and sign: yes, yes in memory of yes
MPM.linkedContent: you can only say and sign: yes, yes in memory of yes

PAS.content: yes, yes: force of affirmative repetition, unique call of the to-come as the will to repeat itself, affirmation that cites itself, joyous EROS, immeasurable unhappiness, irreducible contamination, affirmation risks citation, le oui qui fait dans la langue un trou aussi étrange que viens, il approuve, affirme, contresigne tout ce “qui est arrivé”
PAS.linkedContent: yes, yes: force of affirmative repetition, unique call of the to-come as the will to repeat itself, affirmation that cites itself, joyous EROS, immeasurable unhappiness, irreducible contamination, affirmation risks citation, le oui qui fait dans la langue un trou aussi étrange que viens, il approuve, affirme, contresigne tout ce “qui est arrivé”

PAS.content: Pas est l’oubli, pas d’oubli doublement affirmé (oui, oui)
PAS.linkedContent: Pas est l’oubli, pas d’oubli doublement affirmé (oui, oui)

PAS.content: affirmation of double pas, alliance w/out contract au tout autre (yes, yes), double band of a pact w/out pact
PAS.linkedContent: affirmation of double pas, alliance w/out contract au tout autre (yes, yes), double band of a pact w/out pact

PAS.content: repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none > viens never arrives because of this repetition
PAS.linkedContent: repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none > viens never arrives because of this repetition

PAS.content: neutralization of sexual difference by calling her elle (anonymous, improper name), the de-distancing of viens instructs le pas de différence sexuelle; she is on the other side of the faux pas of the il that does not accompany me: neuter of affirmation, alliance, yes, yes, annulus of récit
PAS.linkedContent: neutralization of sexual difference by calling her elle (anonymous, improper name), the de-distancing of viens instructs le pas de différence sexuelle; she is on the other side of the faux pas of the il that does not accompany me: neuter of affirmation, alliance, yes, yes, annulus of récit

PAS.content: vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt
PAS.linkedContent: vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt

S.content: promise (Versprechen) announces, salutes, what has already taken place “before” (this is the temporality of the coming of the event, Ereignis or Geschehen), it is the dissymmetry of a yes before opposition of yes and no, before question, language always revient à de la promesse
S.linkedContent: promise (Versprechen) announces, salutes, what has already taken place “before” (this is the temporality of the coming of the event, Ereignis or Geschehen), it is the dissymmetry of a yes before opposition of yes and no, before question, language always revient à de la promesse

S.content: before the question, the question mark, language is already there, we have already said yes to it, given a pledge, acquiesced (Zusage,which also means promise, is for Heidegger a commitment of language toward language)
S.linkedContent: before the question, the question mark, language is already there, we have already said yes to it, given a pledge, acquiesced (Zusage,which also means promise, is for Heidegger a commitment of language toward language)

S.content: before the word is the wordless word “yes,” a pre-originary pledge that precedes all engagements w/ language and action
S.linkedContent: before the word is the wordless word “yes,” a pre-originary pledge that precedes all engagements w/ language and action

OH.content: affirmation (faith) in language defies all metalanguage

TC.content: a necessary affirmation can be born only by being reborn to itself [theater of cruelty still to be born]
TC.linkedContent: a necessary affirmation can be born only by being reborn to itself [theater of cruelty still to be born]

TC.content: [see NIETZSCHE & HEGEL on pure expenditure, death, repetition of affirmation, maintaining presence, consume pure difference w/ pleasure]
TC.linkedContent: [see NIETZSCHE & HEGEL on pure expenditure, death, repetition of affirmation, maintaining presence, consume pure difference w/ pleasure]

TC.content: affirmation must be penetrated in repeating itself > murder of father is endless, repeated indefinitely [murder of father: presence representing itself, i.e. a sign, a repetition]
TC.linkedContent: affirmation must be penetrated in repeating itself > murder of father is endless, repeated indefinitely [murder of father: presence representing itself, i.e. a sign, a repetition]

FWT.content: [re: contradictory reaffirmation] passive reception, decision to say “yes,” then selection, interpretation, thus transformation: not to leave safe the very thing one respects before all else > not to leave safe: to save it, perhaps, yet again, w/out illusion of final salvation
FWT.linkedContent: [re: contradictory reaffirmation] passive reception, decision to say “yes,” then selection, interpretation, thus transformation: not to leave safe the very thing one respects before all else > not to leave safe: to save it, perhaps, yet again, w/out illusion of final salvation

FWT.content: we must always reaffirm something of the past to avoid something worse
FWT.linkedContent: we must always reaffirm something of the past to avoid something worse

ROP.content: double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis
ROP.linkedContent: double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis

ROP.content: what rejects analysis: affirmation of gift as trace

OTO.content: yes, yes, given to shadowless [?] gift of high noon, beneath that division whose borders are inundated by sunlight: this is how we can understand Nietzsche’s life
OTO.linkedContent: yes, yes, given to shadowless [?] gift of high noon, beneath that division whose borders are inundated by sunlight: this is how we can understand Nietzsche’s life

OTO.content: it is life, as the living feminine, that must return eternally, selectively > life allied to herself by nuptial annulus, wedding ring
OTO.linkedContent: it is life, as the living feminine, that must return eternally, selectively > life allied to herself by nuptial annulus, wedding ring

OTO.content: btwn title & book to come, exergue situates place from which life will be recited: yes, yes, amen, amen, I sign, I am in debt to “high noon” [instant of signature, no place]
OTO.linkedContent: btwn title & book to come, exergue situates place from which life will be recited: yes, yes, amen, amen, I sign, I am in debt to “high noon” [instant of signature, no place]

OTO.content: good news of EROS is message, is a teaching, address/destination of doctrine, is untimely, differant, since news repeats an affirmation (yes, yes), must give rise to magisterial institution, institutions of the “yes,” which have need of ears
OTO.linkedContent: good news of EROS is message, is a teaching, address/destination of doctrine, is untimely, differant, since news repeats an affirmation (yes, yes), must give rise to magisterial institution, institutions of the “yes,” which have need of ears

OTO.content: institutions of “yes,” have need of ears: Nietzsche doesn’t expect the ears and hands for his truths today—my small ears no small interest to ladies, makes me a monster, anti-ass, Anti-Christ
OTO.linkedContent: institutions of “yes,” have need of ears: Nietzsche doesn’t expect the ears and hands for his truths today—my small ears no small interest to ladies, makes me a monster, anti-ass, Anti-Christ

DIF.content: that differance will never be a unique name, we must affirm this (w/out nostalgia), in the sense that Nietzsche puts affirmation into play, in a certain laughter & step of dance
DIF.linkedContent: that differance will never be a unique name, we must affirm this (w/out nostalgia), in the sense that Nietzsche puts affirmation into play, in a certain laughter & step of dance

WAP.content: CIPH—community of the question [?]: 1) answer to question 2) experience of question 3) thinking of “yes” before question, before philosophy, a yes w/ content only of the other, to whom a trace is addressed in the dark: this deconstructive thinking can/must lead to philosophy (to which it doesn’t belong); pledge of/before philosophy: space open & closed by pledge
WAP.linkedContent: CIPH—community of the question [?]: 1) answer to question 2) experience of question 3) thinking of “yes” before question, before philosophy, a yes w/ content only of the other, to whom a trace is addressed in the dark: this deconstructive thinking can/must lead to philosophy (to which it doesn’t belong); pledge of/before philosophy: space open & closed by pledge

WAP.content: “thinking is faithful to an affirmation whose responsibility places it before philosophy”
WAP.linkedContent: “thinking is faithful to an affirmation whose responsibility places it before philosophy”

WAP.content: affirmation, if there is any, non-negotiable, uncompromising, unconditional
WAP.linkedContent: affirmation, if there is any, non-negotiable, uncompromising, unconditional

DPi.content: for Montaigne, there’s always something worth more than life, exceeding life, force of an opining (to say yes), belief, a force of force, a force of act of faith that says yes > this, acc. Montaigne, is the essence of religion: acceptance of sacrificial death & DP in shadow of a sur-viving supposedly worth more than life > religion grants the surviving of survival
DPi.linkedContent: for Montaigne, there’s always something worth more than life, exceeding life, force of an opining (to say yes), belief, a force of force, a force of act of faith that says yes > this, acc. Montaigne, is the essence of religion: acceptance of sacrificial death & DP in shadow of a sur-viving supposedly worth more than life > religion grants the surviving of survival

DPi.content: trapeze artist says “yes” (net saves him) until he doesn’t/dies
DPi.linkedContent: trapeze artist says “yes” (net saves him) until he doesn’t/dies

PF.content: reaffirm the “it is necessary” of “w/out alibi”

PSSS.content: originary affirmation, which advances itself in advance, lends [?] rather than gives itself?
PSSS.linkedContent: originary affirmation, which advances itself in advance, lends [?] rather than gives itself?

PSSS.content: beyond the beyond, not a sovereignty, not a principle
originary affirmation is attached to a life, but an im-possible life, a sur-vival, not symbolizable, but the only one worthy of being lived, w/out alibi, the one from which to depart
PSSS.linkedContent: originary affirmation is attached to a life, but an im-possible life, a sur-vival, not symbolizable, but the only one worthy of being lived, w/out alibi, the one from which to depart

PSSS.content: one cannot justify pacifism, right to life, setting out from an economy of life, can only be done on basis of a sur-vival that owes nothing to alibi of some mytho-theological beyond
PSSS.linkedContent: one cannot justify pacifism, right to life, setting out from an economy of life, can only be done on basis of a sur-vival that owes nothing to alibi of some mytho-theological beyond

EL.content: “we” of covenant, not secularized “communal subject,” countersigns by responding to commitment already taken: autobiographicity of “we” assigned by call resonating from sacred language > in sacrificial instant, one hears imminence of God’s voice’s return
EL.linkedContent: “we” of covenant, not secularized “communal subject,” countersigns by responding to commitment already taken: autobiographicity of “we” assigned by call resonating from sacred language > in sacrificial instant, one hears imminence of God’s voice’s return

HST.content: one must (il faut) welcome w/out “one must” (sans “il faut”)
HST.linkedContent: one must (il faut) welcome w/out “one must” (sans “il faut”)

HST.content: absolute hospitality: say “yes” to the coming of le tout autre, absolutely inanticipable stranger
HST.linkedContent: absolute hospitality: say “yes” to the coming of le tout autre, absolutely inanticipable stranger

TN.content: for Chrétian, Christ is one, common body, not a plurality of bodies > Chrétian & Nancy deal w/ a different “yes,” or a different provenance of same “yes,” addressed to “you”
TN.linkedContent: for Chrétian, Christ is one, common body, not a plurality of bodies > Chrétian & Nancy deal w/ a different “yes,” or a different provenance of same “yes,” addressed to “you”

TN.content: Nancy’s “yes”: consent to touch a body to come
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s “yes”: consent to touch a body to come

TN.content: [re: Nancy’s list of touchable bodies] finite series, symphonic “yes” of pleasure
TN.linkedContent: [re: Nancy’s list of touchable bodies] finite series, symphonic “yes” of pleasure

NOY.content: yes no longer suffers any metalanguage, all subjects arise from the scene of the yes ——yes’s essential, irreducible infinity: presupposed by negation, opposition, dialectics too
NOY.linkedContent: yes no longer suffers any metalanguage, all subjects arise from the scene of the yes ——yes’s essential, irreducible infinity: presupposed by negation, opposition, dialectics too

NOY.content: de Certeau: knowledge’s procedure is essentially a “no,” mystic postulate advances a limitless “yes”
NOY.linkedContent: de Certeau: knowledge’s procedure is essentially a “no,” mystic postulate advances a limitless “yes”

NOY.content: St. Paul: “in Him there has been only Yes (nai)” > de Certeau: this “yes” pierces field of distinctions/separations practiced by Hebraic epistemology
NOY.linkedContent: St. Paul: “in Him there has been only Yes (nai)” > de Certeau: this “yes” pierces field of distinctions/separations practiced by Hebraic epistemology

NOY.content: de Certeau: “yes” (Ja) and the Separated (Ja, or Jahvé), yes brings together No-Name of Other and Yes of the Volition
NOY.linkedContent: de Certeau: “yes” (Ja) and the Separated (Ja, or Jahvé), yes brings together No-Name of Other and Yes of the Volition

NOY.content: yes resounds (résonne) in question, always prior to, before, beyond any possible question
NOY.linkedContent: yes resounds (résonne) in question, always prior to, before, beyond any possible question

NOY.content: quasi-transcendental or ontological structure of yes prescribes double destiny, a destiny of duplicity? ——Nietzsche opposes Ja of innocent affirmation with Ja, Ja of the Christian ass
NOY.linkedContent: quasi-transcendental or ontological structure of yes prescribes double destiny, a destiny of duplicity? ——Nietzsche opposes Ja of innocent affirmation with Ja, Ja of the Christian ass

NOY.content: Christian yes, a yes of finitude (repetition and memory); Derrida proposes a more ancient root to annul the alternative [limitless singular yes, finite ass yes]
NOY.linkedContent: Christian yes, a yes of finitude (repetition and memory); Derrida proposes a more ancient root to annul the alternative [limitless singular yes, finite ass yes]

NOY.content: observing separation in Christ’s ‘yes,’ Derrida wants to think a ‘yes’ neither Jewish nor Christian, but quasi, an originary eventness, fable inscribed in the yes—origin of speech (fari)
NOY.linkedContent: observing separation in Christ’s ‘yes,’ Derrida wants to think a ‘yes’ neither Jewish nor Christian, but quasi, an originary eventness, fable inscribed in the yes—origin of speech (fari)

NOY.content: Rosenzweig: Yea circumscribes as inner limit all that is non-Nought, “Amen” behind every word
NOY.linkedContent: Rosenzweig: Yea circumscribes as inner limit all that is non-Nought, “Amen” behind every word

NOY.content: “yes” as “silent accompanist,” a little like Kant’s “I think” > Urwort
NOY.linkedContent: “yes” as “silent accompanist,” a little like Kant’s “I think” > Urwort

NOY.content: yes belongs w/out belonging to whole it institutes and opens; it exceeds and punctures (troue) the language in which it remains immanent: first inhabitant of language, first to step out of its home (sortir de chez lui)
NOY.linkedContent: yes belongs w/out belonging to whole it institutes and opens; it exceeds and punctures (troue) the language in which it remains immanent: first inhabitant of language, first to step out of its home (sortir de chez lui)

NOY.content: the engagement, the promise to come to language
NOY.linkedContent: the engagement, the promise to come to language

NOY.content: is the yes related to volo (will)? or to a more Heideggerian receptivity, the Zusage (pre-engagement) and its relation to Gelassenheit [Eckhart’s Gelâzenheit] (bespeaks non-vouloir)?
NOY.linkedContent: is the yes related to volo (will)? or to a more Heideggerian receptivity, the Zusage (pre-engagement) and its relation to Gelassenheit [Eckhart’s Gelâzenheit] (bespeaks non-vouloir)?

NOY.content: yes must be fictive, quasi, opens every event w/out being itself an event, never present ——any ontology, transcendental statement, presupposes yes, can’t make it it’s theme, quasiment at the beginning
NOY.linkedContent: yes must be fictive, quasi, opens every event w/out being itself an event, never present ——any ontology, transcendental statement, presupposes yes, can’t make it it’s theme, quasiment at the beginning

NOY.content: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)
NOY.linkedContent: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)

NOY.content: a first yes, given its structure, must be a response, d’abord second, to the other (au prochain); yes, already there nonetheless remains to come (déjà là mais reste pourtant à venir)
NOY.linkedContent: a first yes, given its structure, must be a response, d’abord second, to the other (au prochain); yes, already there nonetheless remains to come (déjà là mais reste pourtant à venir)

NOY.content: “second” yes a priori enveloped in “first”: doubled in advance, a repetition which opens and threatens w/ forgetting, simulacrum, contamination
NOY.linkedContent: “second” yes a priori enveloped in “first”: doubled in advance, a repetition which opens and threatens w/ forgetting, simulacrum, contamination

NOY.content: promise of memory, memory of promise, before all psychē, all morality
NOY.linkedContent: promise of memory, memory of promise, before all psychē, all morality

NOY.content: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity
NOY.linkedContent: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity

NOY.content: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second” ——yes, (already but always) faithful countersignature, can’t be counted: it always sends itself off in number (il s’envoie toujours en nombre)
NOY.linkedContent: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second” ——yes, (already but always) faithful countersignature, can’t be counted: it always sends itself off in number (il s’envoie toujours en nombre)

EW.content: in relation to “yes,” Zusage presupposed in every question, one must seek (post-deconstructive) responsibility of the subject
EW.linkedContent: in relation to “yes,” Zusage presupposed in every question, one must seek (post-deconstructive) responsibility of the subject

EW.content: unconditional affirmation that motivates deconstruction can always upset an instituted rhythm of every pause (subject is a pause, stabilizing arrest, the thesis we will always need [?])
EW.linkedContent: unconditional affirmation that motivates deconstruction can always upset an instituted rhythm of every pause (subject is a pause, stabilizing arrest, the thesis we will always need [?])

AD.content: Levinas’ “unconditional yes” exceeds and precedes my freedom
AD.linkedContent: Levinas’ “unconditional yes” exceeds and precedes my freedom

AD.content: hospitality, welcome of face, attention: this series of metonymies are all the same only where they withdraw, like the other, from theme—each welcomes (says “yes” to) the other
AD.linkedContent: hospitality, welcome of face, attention: this series of metonymies are all the same only where they withdraw, like the other, from theme—each welcomes (says “yes” to) the other

AD.content: yes, yes: the welcoming of the other (l’accueil de l’autre) (objective/subjective genitive)
AD.linkedContent: yes, yes: the welcoming of the other (l’accueil de l’autre) (objective/subjective genitive)

AD.content: Levinas on cogito: “it is not I, it is the other that can say yes” > infinity welcomed in anarchy
AD.linkedContent: Levinas on cogito: “it is not I, it is the other that can say yes” > infinity welcomed in anarchy

AD.content: refer to “first” yes in quotes because there’s no first, call is only called from response, we are thrown, begin by responding > tragedy of unanswered call: as necessary as death, finitude
AD.linkedContent: refer to “first” yes in quotes because there’s no first, call is only called from response, we are thrown, begin by responding > tragedy of unanswered call: as necessary as death, finitude

AD.content: call can only be heard in the promise of response
AD.linkedContent: call can only be heard in the promise of response

AD.content: ineluctability (this is necessary) of the 3rd is law of question > question of a question, addressed to the other, from the other: the other of the other > a question that is certainly not first (comes after the yes of/to the other), though nothing precedes it
AD.linkedContent: ineluctability (this is necessary) of the 3rd is law of question > question of a question, addressed to the other, from the other: the other of the other > a question that is certainly not first (comes after the yes of/to the other), though nothing precedes it

AD.content: the possibility of offering hospitality to the worst is necessary so good hospitality has a chance: yes of the other, yes to the other > impossibility of programming a limit btwn pervertibility/perversion is necessary
AD.linkedContent: the possibility of offering hospitality to the worst is necessary so good hospitality has a chance: yes of the other, yes to the other > impossibility of programming a limit btwn pervertibility/perversion is necessary

AD.content: aphoristic energy of déliasion in Levinas’ ethical affirmation: from subordination (no interiorization), to welcome of Most High (host), to unicity of possibility of substitution (hostage)
AD.linkedContent: aphoristic energy of déliasion in Levinas’ ethical affirmation: from subordination (no interiorization), to welcome of Most High (host), to unicity of possibility of substitution (hostage)

AD.content: absolute past: “word of God” —will have taken place before taking place, older than Sinai—truth of messianic exceeds national identity; p. 142n absolute “lateness”: older yes
AD.linkedContent: absolute past: “word of God” —will have taken place before taking place, older than Sinai—truth of messianic exceeds national identity; p. 142n absolute “lateness”: older yes

AD.content: w/ Levinas, “yes” of faith not incompatible w/ atheism—or certain inexistence of God > à-Dieu, unique, more than old, inaugural (& replaceable, exposed to inanities)
AD.linkedContent: w/ Levinas, “yes” of faith not incompatible w/ atheism—or certain inexistence of God > à-Dieu, unique, more than old, inaugural (& replaceable, exposed to inanities)

LG.content: [Blanchot’s] immense double affirmation both to life & death, forming an alliance or marriage bond w/ itself (“hymen”)
LG.linkedContent: [Blanchot’s] immense double affirmation both to life & death, forming an alliance or marriage bond w/ itself (“hymen”)

LG.content: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] as long as I say “yes, yes,” I’m a woman and beautiful, man rendered other: secret and odd hymen > madness of sexual difference, mixing of genres
LG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] as long as I say “yes, yes,” I’m a woman and beautiful, man rendered other: secret and odd hymen > madness of sexual difference, mixing of genres

LG.content: transsexuality permits me, in a more than metaphorical & transferential way, to engender
LG.linkedContent: transsexuality permits me, in a more than metaphorical & transferential way, to engender

LG.content: double affirmation not foreign to the genre, genius or spirit of law: no double affirmation w/out light of day and daylight becoming law > madness of the day
LG.linkedContent: double affirmation not foreign to the genre, genius or spirit of law: no double affirmation w/out light of day and daylight becoming law > madness of the day

CIN.content: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?
CIN.linkedContent: incineration celebrates perhaps the nothing of the all, destruction w/out return, mad w/ its desire, desperate disseminal affirmation but also its opposite: “no” to the work mourning, “no” of fire > how to accept working for his Highness (monseigneur) mourning?

BSi.content: bêtise as self-positing, positivism, positivity itself, across all 3 modes (question, affirmation, negation) > but affirmation, the “yes,’”is not to be reduced to positivity [?]
BSi.linkedContent: bêtise as self-positing, positivism, positivity itself, across all 3 modes (question, affirmation, negation) > but affirmation, the “yes,’”is not to be reduced to positivity [?]

WBH.content: deconstruction not transgression of the Law, it is the Law: it is an affirmation, and affirmation is on side of Law: as soon as you affirm a desire, you perform something which is the Law, the Law says, “yes” (Law is not simply negative, that’s hard to understand)
WBH.linkedContent: deconstruction not transgression of the Law, it is the Law: it is an affirmation, and affirmation is on side of Law: as soon as you affirm a desire, you perform something which is the Law, the Law says, “yes” (Law is not simply negative, that’s hard to understand)

WBH.content: deconstruction is another way of writing Law, affirming new mode of Law, thus not a movement of transgression or liberation
WBH.linkedContent: deconstruction is another way of writing Law, affirming new mode of Law, thus not a movement of transgression or liberation

WBH.content: to receive a gift, in Nietzschean sense, is to say, “I want to begin again,” not a reproduction: “yes” of gift must be repeatable from the start
WBH.linkedContent: to receive a gift, in Nietzschean sense, is to say, “I want to begin again,” not a reproduction: “yes” of gift must be repeatable from the start
